description: From nidor (“the unpleasant smell of some cooked animal substances”) +‎ -ous, or from Medieval Latin nidorosus.

adjectives.description: nidorous (comparative more nidorous, superlative most nidorous)

entries.meaning: (literary) Emitting a strong, unpleasant odor, especially one like that of cooking fat or similar greasy substances.
examples: ‘Taste my breath—is it not fetid, foul, and nidorous?’
